text: The $SPY index gained two point five percent (2.5%). NASDAQ fell $3.75 to close at $14,250.50 per share.
Q1 revenue reached $245.7 million, up 12% year-over-year. Earnings per share (EPS) was $1.73, exceeding analyst estimates of $1.65.
The S&P 500 closed at 4,782.76, up 0.34% for the day. Leading sectors included Technology (+1.2%) and Healthcare (+0.8%), while Energy (-0.6%) lagged behind.

Cash & Equivalents: $245.7M, AR: $189.3M, Inventory: $156.8M, PP&E: $432.6M, Goodwill: $215.9M, Total Assets: $1.24B

BREAKING: $AAPL Reports Record Q1 Revenue of $124.5B, Beating Estimates by 8.3%
Our Q2 revenue grew 15.7% YoY to $876.3M, with gross margins expanding 120bps to 56.4%, resulting in EPS of $2.25.
We maintain our BUY rating on $AMZN with a PT of $195, implying 23% upside from current levels of $158.45.
GDP Growth: +2.3% CPI: +3.1% Unemployment: 4.2% Fed Funds Rate: 3.75-4.00% 10Y Treasury: 3.45%
We expect FY2025 revenue of $3.5B-$3.7B (10-15% YoY) and adj. EPS of $4.50-$4.75, with FCF conversion >90%.
$MSFT to acquire $DATA for $28.5B in all-cash transaction valued at $185/share, representing a 25% premium.
$TSLA will host its Q1 FY2025 earnings call on April 24, 2025, at 5:30 PM ET. Webcast available at investor.tesla.com.
¹Adjusted EBITDA excludes $24.5M in restructuring charges, $12.3M in stock-based compensation, and $8.7M in acquisition-related expenses.
$SPY formed a bullish golden cross as the 50-DMA ($452.35) crossed above the 200-DMA ($445.78) with RSI at 62.5.
$JNJ declared quarterly dividend of $1.15/share (+5.5% YoY), payable on June 15, 2025, to shareholders of record as of May 30, 2025.
5Y revenue CAGR of 12.5%, GM expansion from 53.2% to 55.8%, OpEx/Revenue declining from 32.5% to 29.7%, and effective tax rate of 22%.
$AAPL traded 42.3M shares today (1.5x avg. daily volume), with 68% on lit exchanges and 32% in dark pools. VWAP: $182.45.
$AMZN Jun 21 '25 $180 Calls trading at $12.45 with IV of 35%, delta 0.62, gamma 0.03, theta -0.15, and vega 0.35.
Our FY2024, we delivered revenue of $15.7B (+18.5% YoY), adj. operating margin of 32.5% (+250bps), and GAAP EPS of $6.78 (+24.2%).
Form 8-K filed on May 2, 2025, disclosing CEO purchase of 25,000 shares at avg. price of $132.45/share for total of $3,311,250.
Moody's upgraded $IBM to A2 from A3 with stable outlook, citing improved FCF generation and debt reduction of $5.2B in FY2024.
Consolidated revenue of $8.54B (+12.3% YoY, +14.1% in constant currency) with adj. operating margin of 28.5% (+180bps YoY) and adj. EPS of $3.24 (+18.7%).
Stripe sets IPO price range at $68-$72/share, valuing company at $85B-$90B. Offering 35M shares to raise $2.38B-$2.52B.
$MSFT trades at 28.4x FY25E EPS vs. $GOOGL at 22.7x and $AAPL at 29.3x, with 5Y EPS CAGR of 15.2% vs. 12.7% and 9.8%, respectively.
We forecast $AMZN to grow AWS revenue at 20% CAGR (FY25-27E), with operating margins expanding from 32.5% to 35.7% and $12.5B in incremental FCF by FY2027.
Per Form 13F filed on May 15, 2025, Blackrock increased its position in $NVDA by 2.3M shares (+8.5%) to 29.4M shares valued at $14.7B.

For Q1 FY2025, $AAPL reported revenue of $94.8B (+9.3% YoY), with iPhone contributing $45.6B (+12.5%), Services $23.5B (+17.8%), and Wearables $9.8B (+5.2%). Gross margin expanded 130bps YoY to 43.7%, driving EPS growth of 15.2% to $1.52.

The S&P 500 declined 2.3% this week as the 10Y Treasury yield surged 35bps to 3.85% following the Fed's hawkish commentary. Tech stocks ($XLK -3.8%) underperformed, while defensive sectors like Utilities ($XLU +1.2%) and Consumer Staples ($XLP +0.7%) showed relative strength.

We initiate coverage of $NVDA with an OVERWEIGHT rating and $1,250 price target (45x FY26E EPS), reflecting our bullish outlook on AI-driven growth. We forecast revenue CAGR of 32% (FY25-27E) with GM expanding to 78.5% (+350bps) and FCF conversion improving to 43% of revenue (+500bps).

$AMZN Q1'25 results: Revenue $143.5B (+15.7% YoY), Op. Income $15.3B (+28.9%), Net Income $12.7B (+21.5%), Diluted EPS $1.21 (+23.5%), FCF TTM $43.5B (+42.3%), AWS Revenue $32.8B (+29.5% YoY) with Op. Margin 34.2% (+210bps).

In Q1 FY2025, $AAPL reported revenue of $94.8B (+9.3% YoY) and EPS of $1.52 (+15.2%), both exceeding consensus estimates by 3.5% and 8.2%, respectively. Gross margin expanded 130bps YoY to 43.7%, while operating margin reached 30.5% (+160bps). The company returned $25.3B to shareholders, including $3.8B in dividends ($0.25/share) and $21.5B in share repurchases (35.2M shares at avg. price of $187.35).
